title: Can You Unsend a Snap on Snapchat?

steps.title: While you can't unsend a Snap, you can delete it.
steps.content: While you can't unsend a Snap, you can delete it. You'll be able to delete a Snap whether the user has opened it or not. If you're able to delete the Snap before a user has opened it, they'll only see a notification that you deleted a Snap, not the contents. If the user has opened the Snap, you can still delete it to make sure it's no longer in the chat log. Luckily, Snapchat notifies users if a screenshot was taken , so you'll know if the other user has kept evidence of the message on their device.

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app. This is the white ghost with a yellow background. [1] X Research source Snapchat is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . If you aren't already logged in, tap Sign in to do so now, or create an account . This method may not always work if a user has a faulty internet connection or uses an old version of Snapchat.

steps.title: Tap the Chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the Chat icon. This is the text box icon on the bottom toolbar, to the left of the camera. You'll see a list of all your recently messaged friends.

steps.title: Tap a conversation.
steps.content: Tap a conversation. This will open the chat log.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap you want to delete. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This will be next to a trash can icon. A new window will ask you to confirm your action.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . The Snap or chat message will be deleted from the conversation. The other user will see "(You) deleted a Snap" in the chat log. You can also delete saved messages .

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app. This is the white ghost with a yellow background. [2] X Research source By default, Snapchat will delete Snaps once they've been viewed or have expired. In one-on-one chats, unopened Snaps will automatically delete within 31 days. In group chats, unopened Snaps will be deleted after 7 days.

steps.title: Tap the Chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the Chat icon. This is the text box icon on the bottom toolbar, to the left of the camera. You'll see a list of all your recently messaged friends.

steps.title: Tap and hold on a friend's name or group.
steps.content: Tap and hold on a friend's name or group. A pop-up menu will open. You can also reach this menu by tapping a friend's profile icon, then tapping the three dots icon in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Chat Settings.
steps.content: Tap Chat Settings . This will be underneath Manage Friendship .

steps.title: Tap Delete Chats….
steps.content: Tap Delete Chats… . By default, this will be set to 24 hours after Viewing . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap After Viewing.
steps.content: Tap After Viewing . Chats with this user will now be set to delete after it's been viewed.

steps.title: Open the Snapchat app.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat app. This is the white ghost with a yellow background.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon on the top-left.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon on the top-left. You'll see an image preview of your current posted story. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap My Story.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap My Story . This is the text next to the circular story icon. Your story will expand into posted segments.

steps.title: Tap and hold a segment.
steps.content: Tap and hold a segment. A pop-up menu will open. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete Snap, then Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete Snap , then Delete . This will delete the segment from your story. [6] X Research source You'll need to repeat this process for all segments of your story to fully delete it. When your story is fully deleted, you'll see Add to My Story .
